page.title: 12Wild Flowers.
page.content: On the 14th June, 1985, the children of Timberscombe School recorded the flowers growing in the field through which the River Aville flows, known as "Salts". The field is permanent pasture and belongs to Mr. T. Heard of Timberscombe.He cannot recall it ever being ploughed.The flowers are listed below:Water Forget-me-not,Common Catsear,Dandelion,Meadow Buttercup,Common Sorrel,Red Campion,Red Clover,Foxglove,Herb Robert,Greater Stitchwort,White Clover Self-heal,Ribwort Plantain,Ground Ivy Goosegrass,Rough Chervil,Common Nettle Hogweed,Creeping Thistle,Marsh Thistle Monkey Flower,Ragged Robin,Bush Vetch, Meadowsweet,Hemlock Water Dropwort, Black Knapweed,BirdsfootTrefoil,Yarrow Common Mouse-ear Chickweed.
